intro: Dichapetalum virchowii, commonly known as the African starwood, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
